docs.snippet: JANUARY is the month for wallflower movies, for things that couldn't obtain bookings during the usually profitable Christmas-New Year's week. They often are films that have been hanging around for a while, sometimes for years.
docs.lead_paragraph: JANUARY is the month for wallflower movies, for things that couldn't obtain bookings during the usually profitable Christmas-New Year's week. They often are films that have been hanging around for a while, sometimes for years.

headline.main: It's Junk in January; It's Junk in January

docs.snippet: A long-smoldering crisis in relations between the civilian Government of President Juan M. Bordaberry and the Uruguayan Army and Air Forces has flared into a public confrontation, and sailors sealed streets in the waterfront area of this capital less...
docs.lead_paragraph: A long-smoldering crisis in relations between the civilian Government of President Juan M. Bordaberry and the Uruguayan Army and Air Forces has flared into a public confrontation, and sailors sealed streets in the waterfront area of this capital less than 300 yards from Government House early today.
docs.abstract: Long-smoldering crisis in relations between Uruguay's Pres Bordaberry and army and air force flares into confrontation as Gen C Martinez and Brig J Perez Caldas, replying to Defense Min A Francese's request that they resign, demand his removal; Bordaberry, in TV-radio speech, rejects demand, urges public and armed forces to defend country's insts; sailors seal streets in Montevideo

headline.main: URUGUAY IN GRISIS WITH MILITARY; Two Commanders Demand Defense Minister Quit

docs.snippet: President Juan Maria Bordaberry accepted the resignation of his Defense Minister tonight, bowing to the demands of the army and air force,
docs.lead_paragraph: President Juan Maria Bordaberry accepted the resignation of his Defense Minister tonight, bowing to the demands of the army and air force,
docs.abstract: Uruguayan Pres Bordaberry accepts resignation of Defense Min A Francese, bowing to demands of army and air force, which had been in virtual rebellion; announcement of resignation comes after column of tanks and trucks loaded with soldiers approached capital; earlier, army and air force patrols took over several radio stations and rebel officers reiterated Gen Martinez and Brig Perez Caldas demand for Francese removal; Martinez and Perez Caldas, hrs after announcement, issue communique stating that they intend to 'restore internal order and give security to natl development;' navy had declared solidarity with Pres; armed forces have been eager to expose and eliminate corruption; illus of navy gunboat off Montevideo and of Bordaberry and Francese

headline.main: Uruguay Defense Minister Quits Under Army Threat; Uruguay Defense Chief Bows to Army

headline.main: Uruguay Defense Minister Quits Under Army Threat; Uruguay Defense Chief Bows to Army

docs.snippet: Uruguay's generals, pressed demands today for a "national reconstruction" program amid reports the President Juan Maria Bordaberry might resign.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay's generals, pressed demands today for a "national reconstruction" program amid reports the President Juan Maria Bordaberry might resign.
docs.abstract: Uruguyan navy forces reoccupy port and business dist, Montevideo; Rear Adm J Zorrilla holds talks with Pres Bordaberry

headline.main: URUGUAY OFFICERS PRESSIING DEMANDS; Capital Remains Calm Navy Reoccupies Area Anticorruption Campaign Want Plans to Be Adopted--President May Resign

docs.snippet: Where do ocean powerboat racers go in the winter? Same as ducks and geese-south. The schedule of the Union of International Motorboating world championship provided for Argentina and Uruguay as February racing sites, but only. two "northerners" are...
docs.lead_paragraph: Where do ocean powerboat racers go in the winter? Same as ducks and geese-south. The schedule of the Union of International Motorboating world championship provided for Argentina and Uruguay as February racing sites, but only. two "northerners" are taking advantage of them.

docs.snippet: The Uruguayan Navy tonight joined the army and air force in rebelling against the civilian Government, according to an armed forces communique.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Uruguayan Navy tonight joined the army and air force in rebelling against the civilian Government, according to an armed forces communique.
docs.abstract: Uruguayan navy joins army and air force in rebelling against Pres Bordaberry Govt as deadline nears for acceptance of mil reform program, armed forces communique issued Feb 11; communique, signed by Capt C Olazabal, who is referred to as new navy comdr, says that Rear Adm Zorrilla, who had remained loyal to Bordaberry, resigned; army and air force comdrs entered Pres residence earlier in day, apparently in effort to reopen talks

headline.main: Uruguayan Navy Joins the Other Rebels; Wide Reforms Sought

docs.snippet: The confrontation between Uruguay's armed forces and the civilian Government led by President Juan Maria Bordaberry eased today with the announcement that agreement had been reached on "fundamental points."
docs.lead_paragraph: The confrontation between Uruguay's armed forces and the civilian Government led by President Juan Maria Bordaberry eased today with the announcement that agreement had been reached on "fundamental points."
docs.abstract: confrontation between Uruguay's armed forces and Pres Bordaberry eases on Feb 12 with announcement that accord has been reached on 'fundamental points'; details of accord not made public, but it is believed to assure continuation of civilian rule, under control of mil; army and air force have apparently gained upper hand

headline.main: URUGUAYAN CRISIS EASED BY ACCORD; President and the Military Announce Agreement

byline.original: By MARVINE HOWESpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: The United States announced last night a devaluation of the dollar of 10 per cent against nearly all of the world's major currencies. The devaluation will be greater than 10 per cent against the Japanese yen, which will "float" upward in...
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States announced last night a devaluation of the dollar of 10 per cent against nearly all of the world's major currencies. The devaluation will be greater than 10 per cent against the Japanese yen, which will "float" upward in foreign-exchange trading for an indefinite period.
